title: Counseling Skills Practicum for Enhancing Expert Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational counseling theories and professional fieldwork experience
context.additional_context: A program for science professionals (medical, legal, technical) focusing on acquiring counseling skills applicable to real-life scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five stages of the counseling process (relationship building, problem definition, goal setting, intervention implementation, evaluation) with 80% accuracy through expert video demonstrations (EVD)

Learners can apply observational learning theory in role-play simulations to appropriately use at least three core counseling skills (active listening, empathetic reflection, open-ended questioning) according to situational contexts
Learners can create and submit a reflective report on their counseling session performance through peer feedback and self-assessment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
